data.title: Best walking tour I've ever been on
data.text: Scott is an amazing tour guide.  He is knowledgeable, passionate about his subject matter and truly entertaining.  We took his tour on our first day of vacation and were still comparing other docents to him 5 days later, wishing we could have hired him for our entire 6 day trip.  He talks fast, covers a lot of information and makes it all memorable, understandable and relevant.  Though there were no children in our group I'm absolutely positive he would make it a fabulous adventure for kids. Don't miss this one!

data.title: Great walking tour and history of the city
data.text: We went on a Thursday morning tour with Scott Nelson and had a blast. He is very knowledgable and a great storyteller of the history of Charleston. It was a 2 hr walking tour of the city and the time flew by.  This should be a recommended must do if you are visiting Charleston for the first time and helped get us acquainted to Charleston.

data.title: Very informative
data.text: Scott was awesome! He was energetic and new his history. It poured down on us so I felt a little cheated bc Scott was forced to rush through it, but what I took from it I enjoyed.

data.title: Passionate historian brings old world Charleston alive
data.text: Enjoyed a fact-filled Historic Charleston tour with guide Scott Nelson - a passionate historian who helped bring the origins of Charleston alive. Would recommend any tour with him as his experience and ability to point out why various landmarks were important in history help educate all who are interested.

data.title: The Best Thing You Can Do in a New City
data.text: We took 2 great tours while in Chicago with this company  An Architectural History of Chicago and the North Loop tour.  Both were fantastic.  Our guide (i think his name was Amir - I'm so sorry if I am wrong) was wonderful.  Full of great knowledge and presented with humor.  Just thought he was terrific!   I have taken these tours in many cities, even NY where I live and have learned so much yet presented in a way that is fun, not just facts after facts.   They afford time for pictures and basically I think as I say in my headline, these tours are the best thing you can when visiting a new city.   Can't say enough good things. And you pay what you think is fair - so you can't get better than that.  But just because it CAN be free, please tip these guides - it is their living and you will see they are worth it.  When making reservations, ask about the length of the tour for those with troubles walking- My tours were about 2 miles or so i think

data.title: Excellent tour, great value
data.text: Had a great tour with Scott.  This guy really knows his stuff.  The tour went slightly over the two hours allocated, but I could have happily kept going for longer because Scott made it so interesting.  Unfortunately, he wasn't very well, but that didn't dampen his enthusiasm.  I did a morning tour with him, and then he had some great suggestions for lunch!  Highly recommended.

data.title: CAPTAIN GESTICULATION
data.text: Scott was a great guide and I promised him I'd use his own words to poke a little fun at his penchant for wild arm movements while he speaks. He offered great info about Charleston's past and a window into what created a great city. I'm from the West in the San Diego area, so any building older than 1900 is pretty rare. There were so many that were still standing from the 1700s. I appreciated Scott's knowledge of racial history, which seemed to be drawn from the years he gave tours at Mount Vernon, as I recall his personal history.  I thought the 2 hour tour was well worth the tip I decided to give him.

data.title: Free tour by foot
data.text: What a wonderful way to be introduced to Charleston.  Our guide, Scott, was enthusiastic about his adopted city and gave the first history lesson I thoroughly enjoyed.  He led our group on a leisurely 2-hour walk thru the city, answering all questions with in depth knowledge. (He also pointed out the best bathrooms.). Best of all - the tour was free to skinflints.  The confirmation email suggested a contribution of $25 per person, the going rate for other tours. Scott never even hinted at a tip at the end of the tour.  Everyone's enjoyment was obvious by the generous tips given to Scott. He even made great dinner suggestions.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text:
Free Tours by Foot emailed us four hours before our tour was supposed to happen to let us know that our tour was cancelled due to the tour guide having a medical emergency. We understood, of course -- medical emergencies happen to everyone. The tour guide send us a couple of options for self-guided tours, including museum visits. Unfortunately, we weren't looking for a self-guided tour. It would have been great if they had volunteered to rebook us on a different tour.

I'm sure this would have been a great tour, but unfortunately we didn't get a chance to experience it.

data.title: Fantastic tour
data.text:
Our tour guide Scott was amazing!  He was a font of local knowledge, interesting, energetic and fun.
We even ran in to him later in the day in and it was like running into a friend .

data.title: Free Tours by Foot should be the first thing you do in Charleston
data.text:
Yes, my wife and I did the tour (with Scott). It was great!  Scott was both exceptionally knowledgeable about Charleston and its history, but also incredibly passionate and enthusiastic.  I can appreciate that he does this tour over and over again, but he clearly never tires of telling the stories.
He is very respectful both of the history, and of the rules governing walking tours in the city, not to mention extremely friendly and polite to anyone our group happened to meet.
Seeing a great city, learning some history, and having a ton of fun with Tours by Foot is an experience I would recommend to anyone.

data.title: Historical tour of Charleston
data.text: We were in the area for couple of days. Went on tour with Scott who was very welcoming, extremely knowledgeable of Charleston history and presented it in fun clear way. It was great!

data.title: Fun and informative tour
data.text: We took the free walking tour with Scott last week. He is witty and so knowledgeable about the history of Charleston. Knowing the stories behind the market, historical buildings and beautiful homes made visiting Charleston so much more interesting. Scott is so animated and it's clear he loves his job and his adopted city.

data.title: Informative, thoughtful, entertaining
data.text: Scott is brilliant. We learnt so much about the early history of the City and about its part in the slave trade. His tour was well thought out and hugely entertaining as well being a mine of information.

data.title: It's all in the details.
data.text:
Scott is a wealth of knowledge when it comes to all you want to know about Charleston.
I recommend this tour.

data.title: Walking tour
data.text: The best tour guide we have ever had!!  Any where and any time!  Scott was great.  Very knowledgeable and very personable.  We had 6 people with us...including my girls (ages 12 and 14). Everyone loves him. He made the tour interesting and the history come alive.  Took several tours while in Charleston...this one outranked all of them.

data.title: Thoroughly enjoyed this tour!!
data.text:
Scott provided an informative fun tour of historic Charleston. I feel certain that I experienced the best tour Charleston  had to offer 
My friend's husband was not excited about joining us for the tour at first, but Scott even won him over. 
Don't come to Charleston and  miss out on this tour. Be sure and book the day before as early as possible since the tour fills up quickly.  We got lucky and ended up with the last 3 spots 

Kathy
New Orleans

data.title: Historic Charleston
data.text: Set up a tour for our first full day in Charleston and did not know what to expect. We had such a wonderful tour with Scott! We loved all the history we learned on the tour. He kept us very entertainined. Being a dog lover, it was nice to see that he knew different dog's by name that we passed along the tour. This was one of the highlight's of our stay!

data.title: Great Tour!!
data.text: I recommend this to any traveler coming into Charleston. Scott was an amazing guide!! He knows so much about Charleston history, all the hot spots, and keeps you very intrigued through the whole tour. My husband and I have lived in the area for 2 years now and did this tour when family was in town. Despite living here, we learned so much. This tour is truly a must!! You will not be bored =)

data.title: Best Tours in Charleston
data.text: I've lived in Charleston for a couple of years now but brought some family on this tour. Scott is an amazing guide and speaker, I'm so glad we chose his tour over others and the carriage ride. He gives a more in-dept tour and takes you all around downtown Charleston not just one neighborhood or a set of streets. He is very knowledge about downtown houses and sites, as well as the surrounding areas and all of the events that have unfolded in its history. We went on his Charleston morning tour and had to go back for more on his afternoon Civil War tour, and next time would plan to go on the architecture tour as well!
